1.Pros: It wuz a pretty fun expierence, ya know. I got a job and it wuz good. Got to work the register. pretty complicated, but not if you're smart.
1.Cons: Hate mcdonalds. Everybody there always had a bad attitude and were good for nuthing. the food is all processed and will make you fat as a whale.

2.Pros: Lots of hours for employees but hard to get regular schedule.
2.Cons: For this to be a major cooperation, they do not train their management on how to perform or interact with their employees. Very disorganized, poor practices or standards.

3.Pros: Got a Job quickly, Got a discount on food, Gained responsibilities quickly, got to meet some cool young people like myself
3.Cons: The inability to pick my own hours, having to eat their food every shift = gained weight, managers seemed to have a power trip, sometimes customers were disrespectful

4.Pros: Great company, benefits, pay, food, smell , time
4.Cons: breaks, managment, egh, no, please no

5.Pros: Resume building skills and opportunities for advancement.
5.Cons: All the work of the General Manager without the pay or recognition.

6.Pros: Great start,good work environment learn lots of new things .
6.Cons: Dont stuck ther for a life , there are also so many things to do than Mcdonalds.

7.Pros: Full Time or Part Time / open availability
7.Cons: Depends on if franchise or corporate. I had health insurance through corporate and only paid 20 a week and that was dental and health and now that I am working for a franchise owner they offered me health insurance but double price.

8.Pros: The employees were a blast to work with. There was never a dull moment with them.
8.Cons: Can be very stressful at times. Staffing was hectic at times.
